item.title: Outer symplectic billiard map at infinity
item.description: arXiv:2508.15142v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show that the second iteration $T^2$ of the outer symplectic billiard map with respect to a convex domain $M$ in a symplectic vector space is approximated by an explicit Hamiltonian flow for points far away from $M$. More precisely, denote by $N$ the symplectic polar dual of the symmetrization $M\ominus M$ of $M$. If we write $N$ as the unit level set of a 1-homogeneous function $H$, then the difference between $T^2$ and the time-2-Hamiltonian flow of $H$ applied to a point $x$ is smaller than $c/|x|$ for some constant $c$ depending only on $M$. Moreover, we show that if an orbit escapes to infinity, then its distance to the origin grows not faster than $\sqrt{k}$ in the number of iterations. Finally, we prove that a $k$-periodic orbit needs to be close, in terms of $k$, to $M$.
item.dc:creator: Peter Albers, Ana Chavez Caliz, Serge Tabachnikov

item.title: Darboux's Theorem in $p$-adic symplectic geometry
item.description: arXiv:2508.15443v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $p$ be a prime number. We derive an analog of Moser's Path Method for $p$-adic analytic manifolds and use it to prove a $p$-adic analog of Darboux's Theorem. Hence, in the $p$-adic category there are also no local symplectic invariants other than the dimension, as it happens in the real case: locally near any point, a $2n$-dimensional $p$-adic analytic symplectic manifold is symplectomorphic to $((\mathbb{Q}_p)^{2n},\sum_{i=1}^n\mathrm{d} x_1\wedge\mathrm{d} y_i)$. We also prove a $p$-adic version of Weinstein's generalization of Darboux's Theorem to neighborhoods of compact manifolds (Darboux-Weinstein's Theorem). Finally we apply explicitly Darboux's Theorem to the physical models by Ablowitz-Ladik and Salerno of the Discrete Nonlinear Schr\"odinger equation.
item.dc:creator: Luis Crespo, \'Alvaro Pelayo

item.title: Quantum cohomology of variations of GIT quotients and flips
item.description: arXiv:2508.15770v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove a decomposition theorem for the quantum cohomology of variations of GIT quotients. More precisely, for any reductive group $G$ and a simple $G$-VGIT wall-crossing $X_- \dashrightarrow X_+$ with a wall $S$, we show that the quantum $D$-module of $X_-$ can be decomposed into a direct sum of that of $X_+$ and copies of that of $S$. As an application, we obtain a decomposition theorem for the quantum cohomology of local models of standard flips in birational geometry.
item.dc:creator: Zhaoxing Gu, Song Yu, Tony Yue YU

item.title: Estimating Reeb chords using microlocal sheaf theory
item.description: arXiv:2106.04079v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that for a closed Legendrian submanifold in a 1-jet bundle, if there is a sheaf with compact support, perfect stalk and singular support on that Legendrian, then (1) the number of Reeb chords has a lower bound by half of the sum of Betti numbers of the Legendrian; (2) the number of Reeb chords between the original Legendrian and its Hamiltonian pushoff has a lower bound in terms of Betti numbers when the oscillation norm of the Hamiltonian is small comparing with the length of Reeb chords. In the proof we develop a duality exact triangle and use the persistence structure (which comes from the action filtration) of microlocal sheaves.
item.dc:creator: Wenyuan Li
